guide.title: Beacon User Guide
guide.abstract: This guide shows you how to set up and use Beacon, a GuideXML Editor. GuideXML is a syntax which is used as official format for Gentoo documentation. This document itself was created using Beacon.

body.p: Beacon is a web based WYSIWYG editor for authoring GuideXML documents. It allows you to rapidly create or edit documents without knowing the GuideXML syntax by providing a Rich Text Editor Environment. It also allows the user to directly edit the underlying XML for custom changes.
The following links should tell you more about the Gentoo Documentation and GuideXML syntax:
You can play around with the source code of this document that can be found in the editor's folder.
Beacon needs a PHP enabled web server and a JavaScript enabled browser. Currently supported browsers are:
Start off with fetching a copy of Beacon directly from the webserver using GIT.
Navigate to the trunk/editor/ directory. This is the folder that you have to move to your Webserver's httpdocs and you are done!
Point your browser to the folder you have put Beacon in with the correct address. For example if you have put it in httpdocs/beacon/ you would access it by typing http://www.localhost.com/beacon.
You will be presented with the the landing page of Beacon. Here you can choose to create a new document or edit an existing document.
On clicking New you will be presented with a form with the following fields:

ol.li: Title of the Document: This is what your document will be called. Try to keep it short and sweet. Can be changed later.
Author of the Document: Add your name here. Additional authors and email information later.
Abstract: A summary of the document. Readers should be able to tell with one look what your document is all about.
Date: Use the standard YYYY-MM-DD format! If you didn't you can change it later.

body.p: Click Go! to proceed to the editor screen.

On clicking Edit you will be presented with a file upload form. Choose a valid GuideXML file. Click upload and you will be presented with a preview of the document. Click on Go! to proceed to the Editor.
